content: The "Growing Small Businesses Act" establishes a credit for qualifying production facilities under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. This credit is added as a new paragraph under Section 46 and specifies the amount of credit available for qualifying production facilities. The "Growing Small Businesses Act" introduces a qualifying production facility credit under Section 46 of the Internal Revenue Code. Eligible employers with no more than 50 full-time equivalent employees can receive a 25% credit on eligible property placed in service during the taxable year. The employer cannot claim a facility as previously placed in service if a credit under this section has not been allowed before and the cost of applicable property placed in service in the 5-taxable-year period did not exceed $7,500. Applicable property refers to personal property that would qualify as eligible property if placed in service by an eligible employer.
